```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(reshape2)
```


```{r outlook-plots}

outlook_data <- data.frame(
  Pi_inbox = 3,
  Pi_spam = 115,
  Llama_inbox = 4,
  Llama_spam = 122,
  ChatGPT_inbox = 2,
  ChatGPT_spam = 70,
  Enron_Inbox = 59,
  Enron_spam = 37
)

outlook_data <- melt(outlook_data, variable.name = "Category", value.name = "Count")

print(outlook_data)

distribution_plot <- outlook_data %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Category, y = Count, fill = Category)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Paired") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  labs(title = "Inbox and Spam Counts by LLM", x = "LLM and Class", y = "Count")

distribution_plot

```
